instruction: Please review the chart below and compare the performance of a 60/40 portfolio with and without ESG and climate core preference during the study period.
output: According to the chart, the 60/40 portfolio combined with an ESG and climate core preference outperformed its market-cap-weighted benchmark by 45 basis points per year, while maintaining less risk, during the study period. Therefore, investing in a climate-first portfolio can lead to significant improvements in sustainability without taking on more risk or sacrificing performance.
